_metadata.title: Mendix Workflows - Complete Reference (Studio Pro 11)
_metadata.description: Comprehensive guide to Mendix Workflows including elements, activities, engine, and best practices

introduction.overview: Workflow is a visual language in Mendix Studio Pro that allows you to build extendable business processes. It is fully integrated with other visual editors including the microflow editor and page editor.
keyBenefits: Compliance management - ensures adherence to regulations with clear audit trails
Performance improvement - identifies bottlenecks, reduces task completion time
Risk reduction - prevents overdue penalties, anticipates bottlenecks
Visual process design - drag and drop workflow elements
Full integration with microflows, nanoflows, and pages

variables.$WorkflowContext: Instance of the business-related entity that travels through the workflow

idealCriteria: Tasks are repeatable and performed regularly
Combination of human and automated tasks
Process is stable with minimal variations
avoidWorkflowsWhen: Most criteria above are NOT met
High degree of collaboration with no clear path
Individuals need freedom to decide next actions
Process is outcome-driven rather than step-driven

WorkflowContext.description: Business-related data that travels through the workflow
WorkflowContext.usage: Configure in workflow properties to pass context entity

triggers: Call workflow on-click event on pages

endEvent.description: Ends the path of the workflow

decision.description: Makes a choice based on a condition, follows exactly one outgoing path

parallelSplit.description: Adds two parallel paths to your workflow

jump.description: Jump to other activities in the workflow

waitForNotification.usage: Wait for external events or manual triggers

annotation.description: Add comments to workflows or individual activities

userTask.description: Assign a task to a user or group using filters or microflows
features: Configurable task name and description with variables
User assignment via filters or microflows

multiUserTask.description: Assign same task to multiple users with aggregated outcomes
features: Each user performs the same task
Outcomes aggregated based on completion condition

timer.description: Configure duration or specific date/time in workflow

callMicroflow.description: Calls a selected microflow from workflow
callMicroflow.usage: Execute business logic, integrations, data processing

completeUserTask.description: Programmatically complete a user task with specified outcome

generateJumpToOptions.description: Get list of possible activities to jump to

retrieveWorkflows.description: Get System.Workflow objects for a context

notifyWorkflow.description: Resume workflow waiting on Wait for notification

workflowCommons.description: Marketplace module with preconfigured workflow components

bestPractices.practice: Keep workflows focused on business processes
bestPractices.rationale: Use microflows for technical implementations, workflows for business logic
Saves development time with preconfigured pages and templates
Workflows work best for stable, well-defined processes
Break complex processes into modular, reusable workflows
Configure workflow security to control who can execute and complete tasks
